author: Megumi Fujikawa
title: Japan’s Central Bank Has Hopeful Forecast for Effect of Sales-Tax Increase
text:
TOKYO—Japan’s central bank believes the nation can withstand a sales-tax increase scheduled for next year and avoid the sharp slowdown that followed earlier increases, say people familiar with the Bank of Japan’s thinking.
The central bank will release on Friday its first forecast for the year ending March 2021, the first full fiscal year in Japan following the planned increase in the tax to 10% in October 2019 from the current 8%.
